inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: TTE revealed severe aortic stenosis with worsening LV function. EF was 25%. RV pressure was 41 and had biatrial enlargement.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient underwent a preop workup for valvular replacement with preop chest CT scan and carotid US (showing moderate heterogeneous plaque with bilateral 1-39% ICA stenosis). He also underwent a cardiac cath with right heart cath to evaluate his pulm art pressures which showed no angiographically apparent flow-limiting coronary artery disease.

inclusion.criterion: The Heart Team, including at least one cardiothoracic surgeon and one interventional cardiologist, deem the patient to be reasonable for transfemoral TAVR with a commercially available bioprosthetic valve
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The Heart Team agrees that the patient is low-risk, quantified by an estimated risk of ≤3% by the calculated STS score for operative mortality at 30 days
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Expected survival is at least 24 months
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Concomitant disease of another heart valve or the aorta that requires either transcatheter or surgical intervention
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any condition that is considered a contraindication for placement of a bioprosthetic aortic valve (e.g. patient requires a mechanical aortic valve)
exclusion.label: unknown
